alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Norfolk and northwestern Bristol Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Franklin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Brief heavy downpours could lead to localized minor street flooding. Locations impacted include... Taunton, Franklin, North Attleborough, Stoughton, Attleboro, Walpole, Mansfield, Easton, Norton, Sharon, Foxborough, Bellingham, Norfolk, Wrentham and Plainville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
